channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-12758] Parallel compilation: Operator::resetId() is not thread-safe
item.description:
private static AtomicInteger seqId;

...



  public Operator() {

    this(String.valueOf(seqId.getAndIncrement()));

  }



  public static void resetId() {

    seqId.set(0);

  }

Potential race-condition.
item.summary: Parallel compilation: Operator::resetId() is not thread-safe

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Unfortunately, getting rid of the global properly resulted in a giant patch.
We don't do multi-thread compilation (as in one query never spawns threads) - this variable needs to be made a thread-local.
That said, an object CompileContext is always a good idea - helps us add more info there for the future.
Not another threadlocal... 0_o
We need to add a check to ptest that would emit a grumpy cat if threadlocals are added. And non-capitalized statics.
This breaks operator serialization in some unobvious way, everything is null on the exec side. Grrr. Trying to figure it out.
You need a public no-arg constructor for Kryo.
Oh great. Now I have to add the bloody thing to every operator again. I wish I'd used the threadlocal 0_o
Fixing stuff.
Pretty sure they could be private ctors, which would prevent anyone else from abusing it.

maybe mostly with a dumb awk script?


#!/usr/bin/awk -f

/Kryo ctor; don't use/ { change=1; print; next;}

/public / { if (change == 1) { sub(/public /,"private ");} }

/./ { change = 0; print; }
